intro: Veratrum bosniacum, commonly known as the Bosnian false hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and large, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of pale green to white flowers during the summer months. It contains toxic alkaloids, making it potentially harmful to humans and animals. Due to its toxicity and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native habitat.
